page.title: 09Farming concerns in Caerhun
page.content: The community is Welsh-speaking, closely-knit, industrious and keen to help each other.Farmers' wives use modern appliances for household tasks. They shop in Llanrwst, a traditional market town. It is felt that home industries and improved roads might attract young families into the community and prevent it becoming a dormitory area for nearby towns. All farmers would like to increase their farms' holdings and profitability. Those that are tenants would like to buy their farms. Farm workers' wages are high so farmers rely for help on their families who are prepared to work long, irregular hours. Conserv- ationists insist on preserving rare plants e.g. orchids, flax so some land use is lost but compensation is avail- able. Problems are caused by walkers damaging walls and leaving gates open.
